channel.title: Red Stone Data
channel.description: Recent content on Red Stone Data

item.title: Analyzing Fire Emblem Heroes data
item.description: Introduction (Edited April 18th, 2018) This is a continuation of my previous post, in which we scraped data about the mobile game Fire Emblem Heroes using the R package rvest. This time, we’re going to do some exploratory data analysis to get a better idea about the characters in the game and do some clustering analysis on the characters. Loading libraries library(ggplot2) library(reshape2) library(ggthemes) library(proxy) library(ggdendro) library(WGCNA) library(dynamicTreeCut) library(ggrepel) Data analysis In my last post, we obtained character stats data, as well as movement and weapon type information:

item.title: Fire Emblem Heroes data with rvest
item.description: Introduction In this post, we will attempt to collect some data about the mobile game Fire Emblem Heroes by Intelligent Systems and Nintendo. To do this, we’ll use the rvest package to scrape data from the Fire Emblem Heroes Gamepedia page Loading packages library("rvest") ## Warning: package 'rvest' was built under R version 3.4.4 Scraping data Fire Emblem Heroes is a tactical RPG game in which players compete against the AI by trying to defeat their teams, composed of up to four characters (heroes).

item.title: About
item.description: Pedro Russo This blog is intended to document my journey through the world of data science/bioinformatics/programming/machine learning/text mining/*insert cool topic here*. I’m a Biotechnologist by degree but have been since converted to the tech world thanks to my (currently ongoing) PhD in Bioinformatics, in which I work with gene co-expression networks and develop the R package CEMiTool (and a few others *wink, wink*). I’m also very interested in videogames, music and languages, and more often than not these topics will be the subject of my analyses on the site.
